body_html: I was trying to use batch norm with a 2 layered densely connected NN with the (flatten) MNIST (and relu units) data set for the task of auto-encoding and I keep getting a NaN error. Anyone know why might this be? Is this ever possible with BN? seem fishy, but it couldn't be my learning set up, rate etc. (but I'd assume it shouldn't because BN should be sort of rubust to this)

body: I was trying to use batch norm with a 2 layered densely connected NN with the (flatten) MNIST  (and relu units) data set for the task of auto-encoding  and I keep getting a NaN error. Anyone know why might this be? Is this ever possible with BN? seem fishy, but it couldn't be my learning set up, rate etc. (but I'd assume it shouldn't because BN should be sort of rubust to this)
